medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Two days prior to admission, the patient experienced increasing weakness, lethargy, chills, and diarrhea. His family noted that he became less responsive and increasingly irritable and confused. He stopped taking medications and by the day of admission, he had oral intake of only 500 ml of liquid. He was reported to be in an 'almost catatonic' state with recurrent epistaxis and pain in his chest and left arm.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diabetes mellitus, atrial fibrillation, coronary artery disease, diastolic heart failure, pulmonary hypertension, recurrent epistaxis since childhood, hyperlipidemia, pancytopenia, obstructive sleep apnea, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and a previous diagnosis of atypical pneumonia. Past surgeries included excision of basal-cell carcinoma and appendectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Parents died in their 70s; father had heart disease, mother had a stroke. There is a family history of recurrent epistaxis and easy bleeding in the mother and daughter.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with his wife and is retired from a position in higher education. He does not smoke tobacco, drink alcohol, or use illicit drugs.
